feature: Enhance Contact Section with CTA Buttons
description: Transform the contact section plain text links (LinkedIn, Twitter) into prominent, button-styled call-to-action elements using existing .btn and .btn-primary CSS classes to make it easier for AI company recruiters to contact Abe.

phases.name: Add Secondary Button Style
phases.description: Create a secondary/outline button style variation to complement the primary button, allowing visual hierarchy between buttons

subtasks.title: Add .btn-secondary CSS class
subtasks.description: Add a secondary button style with teal accent color (matching the existing accent-link hover color) to create visual variety between CTA buttons. The primary button (LinkedIn) should be more prominent with solid fill, while secondary (Twitter) uses an outline style.
acceptance_criteria: .btn-secondary class added to styles
Uses teal accent color (--color-teal-500) for border and text
Transparent background with visible border
Hover state with teal background and white text
Maintains consistent sizing with .btn-primary
subtasks.notes: Successfully added .btn-secondary CSS class with teal accent color (--color-teal-500). The secondary button style features transparent background, teal border and text, with hover state showing teal background and white text. Updated base .btn transition to smoothly handle all property changes. Maintains consistent sizing with .btn-primary.

phases.name: Update Contact Section HTML
phases.description: Transform the contact section links from plain text to styled buttons

subtasks.title: Apply button classes to contact links
subtasks.description: Update the LinkedIn and Twitter links in the contact section to use the .btn class along with .btn-primary (for LinkedIn, the primary professional contact) and .btn-secondary (for Twitter).
acceptance_criteria: LinkedIn link has classes: btn btn-primary
Twitter link has classes: btn btn-secondary
Links remain functional with correct href values
Remove accent-link class from these elements
subtasks.notes: Successfully updated LinkedIn and Twitter links in the contact section to use button classes. LinkedIn now uses 'btn btn-primary' for prominence as the primary professional contact, while Twitter uses 'btn btn-secondary' for the teal outline style. Removed the accent-link class from both elements. Links remain fully functional with correct href values.

phases.name: Enhance Button Styling for Contact Section
phases.description: Adjust button styles for better visual impact as CTA elements

subtasks.title: Increase button size and prominence
subtasks.description: Update .btn base styles to use larger padding and font size for better visual impact as CTA buttons. The current 11px font and 8px/12px padding is quite small for prominent CTAs.
acceptance_criteria: Button padding increased for better click target
Font size increased for better readability
Maintains proportional appearance
Works well on both desktop and mobile
subtasks.notes: Successfully updated .btn base styles for better visual impact as CTA buttons. Increased font-size from var(--text-xs) (11px) to var(--text-md) (14px) for better readability. Increased padding from var(--space-2) var(--space-3) (8px 12px) to var(--space-3) var(--space-5) (12px 20px) for better click targets and visual prominence. These changes apply to both .btn-primary and .btn-secondary buttons in the contact section while maintaining proportional appearance.

subtasks.title: Update social-links-inline layout for buttons
subtasks.description: Adjust the .social-links-inline container styles to properly display button-styled elements instead of inline text links. May need gap adjustment and flex-wrap for mobile.
acceptance_criteria: Buttons display properly side by side on desktop
Adequate spacing between buttons
Buttons wrap gracefully on mobile if needed
Consistent with overall site design
subtasks.notes: Successfully updated .social-links-inline container styles to properly display button-styled elements. Added flex-wrap: wrap for graceful wrapping on narrow screens, align-items: center for proper vertical alignment, and adjusted gap from var(--space-5) to var(--space-4) (16px on desktop, 12px on mobile). Removed mobile overrides for font-size and padding that were designed for text links, allowing buttons to maintain their own styling. Buttons now display properly side by side on desktop and wrap gracefully on mobile devices.

phases.name: Mobile Responsiveness
phases.description: Ensure CTA buttons work well on all screen sizes

subtasks.title: Add responsive styles for contact buttons
subtasks.description: Update mobile media queries to ensure contact CTA buttons are properly sized and spaced on smaller screens. Buttons should be easily tappable (min 44px touch target) on mobile devices.
acceptance_criteria: Buttons have adequate touch targets on mobile (min 44px)
Appropriate spacing on small screens
Text remains readable on all screen sizes
Buttons don't overflow container on narrow screens

subtasks.title: Visual verification and final review
subtasks.description: Verify the contact section buttons display correctly, are accessible, and provide a clear call-to-action for visitors. Check that links work and styling is consistent.
acceptance_criteria: Buttons visually stand out as CTAs
Both LinkedIn and Twitter links work correctly
Hover states are visible and functional
Implementation matches spec intent
No visual regressions elsewhere on the page

final_acceptance: Contact section links are styled as prominent CTA buttons
LinkedIn uses primary button style (solid blue)
Twitter uses secondary button style (teal outline)
Buttons are responsive and work on all screen sizes
